channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report E-2024070399
item.description:
Report E-2024070399

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-12
  • City: CHATTANOOGA
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 12, 2024, three (3) 2-gallon containers of UN1760 were crushed in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the concrete surfaces of the loading dock. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were contained in six (6) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024071036
item.description:
Report X-2024071036

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-09
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was found during sort operations at the MEMH location. The fiberboard box contained a single metal drum. The drum was dented of the bottom chime causing the release. It was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024071030
item.description:
Report X-2024071030

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-07
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 7 during the AM sort a drum was found to be leaking. The drum contained 3082, ENVIRONMENTALLY HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE, LIQUID, N.O.S.(TETRAMETHYL ACETY), 9, III. Approximately 2 L leaked out. The drum was placed into a steel salvage drum and the shipper was contacted to provide an amended shippers declaration.

item.title: Report X-2024071029
item.description:
Report X-2024071029

  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 6th during the PM sort, a package was found during the PM sort that was leaking. The package contained UN1263, Paint, 3, II. The lid on the inner can was loose causing the liquid to leak out. The package was contained in a steel salvage drum and the shipper was contacted for an amended shippers declaration.

item.title: Report X-2024071145
item.description:
Report X-2024071145

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-02
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: No spill. Hazmat, undeclared (no DOT labels/markings on outer packaging, no Overpack label). Torn fiberboard box. One 76lb SAFT No. 414975 Mod. 409CH2 NiCad Battery Assy. Note: inner packaging (also a fiberboard box) has UNPOP, diamond label, UN number, and Proper Shipping Name. No OP-950A, OP-900, or HAZ SVC code.

item.title: Report X-2024071034
item.description:
Report X-2024071034

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-02
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was discovered with signs of release at the MEMH location. The fiberboard box contained four metal cans that all had positive closure rings, inside of plastic bags and separated by fiberboard dividers. One of the cans was received a dent in the body that caused the lid to open and spill it's contents. All items were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024071032
item.description:
Report X-2024071032

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-02
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was found with signs of a release at the MEMH location. The fiberboard box contained three glass jars wrapped in layers of brown paper and taped closed with Styrofoam peanuts foe dunnage. A lid on one of the jars was not sealed properly and that was the cause of the release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024070410
item.description:
Report E-2024070410

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO CNW, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 50-gallons of Spectrum 22 released from one (1) 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS reviewed the SDS and dispatched HEPACO to assist with cleanup. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 40ft-by-10ft area of the trailer floor and asphalt underneath the trailer and estimated that fifty (50) gallons of material was released due to an unknown reason from one (1) 330-gallon tote. The fire department was on site and blocking the spill with absorbents. HEPACO personnel transferred the remaining material in the tote to vented poly drums. HEPACO thoroughly cleaned all impacted surfaces. The waste and damaged tote was containerized into poly drums for disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 5th, during the PM sort a pallet of drums was found leaking. The drums contained UN1263, Paint, 3, III. Two of the drums were damaged at the handles, one was damaged at the top chime, the last one was damaged at the bottom chime. The four leaking drums were placed into a steel salvage drums and amended shippers declarations were requested.

item.description:
Report E-2024070265

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-15T18:15:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-03
  • City: CHATTANOOGA

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 3, 2024, one (1) 50-pound bag of sodium hydroxide was damaged by a forklift and released approximately four (4) pounds of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools to collect the loose product and damaged bag. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was found with signs of a release at the MEMH location. The fiberboard box contained three glass jars wrapped in layers of brown paper and taped closed with Styrofoam peanuts foe dunnage. A lid on one of the jars was not sealed properly and that was the cause of the release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.
